results.title: Senior Product Designer
results.description:
We are ThinkShout, a fully distributed, certified B Corp dedicated to delivering exceptional web development, design, user experience, and strategy to the nonprofits and forward-thinking organizations that inspire us.

We're looking for a Senior Product Designer to lead project work, inspire our clients, and engage in shaping our design team in a time of critical department growth.. User experience is at the forefront of how we create intuitive, innovative, and inspiring communication. You’ll collaborate with fellow designers and departments to create innovative design solutions that have a greater impact for our clients.

Requirements

Qualifications:
  • 5+ years of relevant industry experience, designing large-scale websites and engaging digital products
  • A visual thinker with strong color, typographic, and UX/UI skills with a knack for design systems
  • Advanced level of proficiency with design programs like Figma and Adobe Creative Suite
  • Knowledge of how designs are applied in HTML and CSS as well as CMS platforms; Wordpress and Drupal are a plus
  • A deep understanding of accessible, inclusive and user-centered design practices
  • An awareness of the inherent white supremacy of design thinking and actively making efforts to decolonize one’s individual design practice
  • Strong communication skills, ability to present and defend work to peers and executive-level stakeholders
  • Experience working with existing brands and design systems in order to maintain brand voice and visual identity; Brand design experience a plus
  • Experience creating reusable components & design patterns to scale and fit variety of content and technical requirements as well as in-line with project budgets
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and an agile self-starter, able to contribute to projects with varying levels of direction, and pivot flexibly as project plans shift
  • Experience working independently and on multidisciplinary teams, and collaborating with strategists, developers and other designers in supporting large-scale projects
  • Dedication and self-management skills; Experience mentoring fellow designers a plus

Bonus Points:
  • Front-end development experience
  • Motion, video, interactive storytelling examples

Essential Responsibilities:
  • Owning and leading projects while collaborating closely with strategists, developers, and other designers to ideate, iterate, and bring innovative and intuitive solutions to the table
  • Building and maintaining creative offerings for ThinkShout's client work, participating in all UX and visual design stages of a project from concept through final hand-off to our development team, and serving as design advisor through implementation
  • Working within established brands and design systems; expanding them where needed
  • Creating, organizing, and documenting all your designs in Figma with extreme detail
  • Managing your time between projects of varying size and complexity with a dedicated focus to elevating your craft

Benefits

The Fine Print

ThinkShout is a fully distributed company and we welcome applications from candidates who have the unrestricted right to work in the USA.

ThinkShout is primarily a time and materials agency. In the role of Senior Product Designer, there is a weekly expectation of 30 billable hours. We work hard to maintain a 40 hour work week and we’re committed to supporting flexible schedules.

The salary band for this position is $80-105k. In addition, we offer a comprehensive benefits package, including:

  • Health insurance with dental, vision, and alternative care
  • Company funded Health Reimbursement Account
  • 401k with a 3% company contribution and no matching requirement
  • Quarterly Profit Share program
  • Life insurance and short term disability insurance
  • Paid Family and Medical Leave
  • 32 days of PTO annually, including holidays
  • Paid sabbatical after 5 years with the company
  • Professional development funds
  • Excellent management support and a well thought-out yearly review process


ThinkShout is made up of people with a variety of backgrounds and lifestyles. We embrace diversity and invite applications from people of all walks of life. We recognize that our company isn't as diverse as it should be and we're trying to change that. If you aren't sure whether you qualify, please apply anyway. We would much prefer to have an extra application to consider than for you to screen yourself out. We don't discriminate against employees or applicants based on gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, race, religion, age, national origin, citizenship, disability, pregnancy status, veteran status or any other differences. Also, if you have a disability, please let us know if there's any way we can make the interview process better (jobs@thinkshout.com). We are happy to accommodate.


Next Steps

Please submit a resume (no more than 2 pages) in PDF format. We request that you do not submit a cover letter. In its place, we have a few questions for you to answer in the job application. These questions will help us learn more about you and are an integral component of the interview process.

If you are selected to move forward, here’s what you can expect:

  • Round 1 is a 25-minute screening call
  • Round 2 is a 55-minute panel interview in which you will present a project from your portfolio followed by a Q&A
  • Round 3 is a 45-minute finalist interview

We are looking to fill this position for a January start date.

Please note that candidates must reside and be eligible to work in the United States.

results.title: Software Engineer - Backend
results.description:
ABOUT US

Retail returns suck. We all hate packing, printing, and shipping unwanted items only to wait weeks for a refund … And retailers have it rough too. They have to figure out what has to be re-sold, refurbished, or recycled, and if they don't figure it out fast enough, they might as well send everything to a landfill. Nobody wins.

This is why ReturnBear exists. We are Canada's first end-to-end reverse logistics solution. Our nationwide drop-off network means immediate exchanges and returns with no re-packing. We sort and QA goods to get inventory back to merchants fast, giving retailers 20%+ savings and making consumers happier. We make returns easy for everyone and better for the planet.

 

YOUR ROLE

As an engineer at ReturnBear, you'll get a chance to own a piece of the code that powers a key part of our business.  You'll be encouraged to speak with the product and operations teams and be actively involved in feature creation, rather than just passively deliver on feature requests. We feel that early input from engineering is key to success.

As an individual contributor, you'll be given the opportunity to specialize and do high quality work.  We want you to become an expert in your own domain.  You'll ship code but also be a part of peer reviewing your team's code.

We are looking for backend and fullstack engineers with at least 3 years of experience in some of the following technologies and frameworks.

Backend

  • Python
  • Django
    • GraphQL - Strawberry or Graphene
    • Public API generation and documentation
  • Testing

 

HIRING PROCESS

Candidates will be assessed at each of the following steps.

 

APPLICATION

  • We receive your profile, resume, etc.

 

INTRO: 15 min

  • Online conference call with Head of Engineering

 

TAKE-HOME EXERCISE: Return within 7 days of receiving. 

  • Open ended coding exercise submitted on GitHub

 

PAIR PROGRAMMING: 1.5 hours

 

  • With 2 engineering leads.
  • Real-world problem solving exercise.

 

CULTURE FIT WITH CEO: 45 min



COMPENSATION

Salary

  • We are a well-funded startup and can pay competitive salaries.

Benefits

  • Full health benefits

Equity

  • 0.008% to 0.01%



 
WHAT WE LOOK FOR
  • Ownership mentality. “It's their problem, not mine” doesn't have a place here. You own the problems and challenges that you see, and proactively work with your colleagues to turn them into opportunities. We're in it together!
  • Growth mindset. You learn from your mistakes and believe in human potential. It's not that you can't overcome the challenge you're facing, it's just that you haven't overcome it yet. You appreciate the diverse thoughts and perspectives of your colleagues, partners and clients, and you are committed to actively listening and learning.
  • Getting things done. You are keen to do great work, and ship things often. “Done is better than perfect” might be something you believe in, and while you always strive to deliver what is best for you and your team, you realize that sometimes you'll have to circle back on it to iterate and make improvements.
  • Flexibility and comfort in ambiguity. You embrace the agile nature of design and development, and you are equally comfortable pivoting your plan and process as you are establishing a workback schedule. Try as we might, things won't always go as planned, and you always try to be ready to deal with that as it comes.
  • Passion for the problems we're solving. You understand how ecommerce and retail ecosystems are growing with emerging brands and solution providers, and you're keen to make an impact not just on the lives of customers, but on the businesses of our merchant partners and on the environment as well. Together we can save merchants and their customers time and money, AND we can help keep returns out of landfills.
 
OUR COMMITMENTS
  • Diversity and inclusion. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates regardless of their background, sexuality, physical abilities and ways of self-identification.
  • Honing your craft, your way. We provide the opportunities to develop your skills and knowledge. We work collaboratively and flexibly, with opportunities to shape a hybrid working style suited to your needs.
  • All-you-can-pop bubble wrap. The popit craze has nothing on good ol' bubble wrap. Pop your way to zen, in true reverse logistics style.

results.title: Bookkeeper
results.description:
Who We Are

We go beyond software. Carbon6 is building a community to support ecommerce sellers by removing the barriers to selling online and simplifying their path to success. Developed by the brightest minds in the marketplace ecosystem, our suite of software tools and resources help entrepreneurs succeed at every stage of their journey. We are a global company across North America, Europe and Asia, made up of passionate entrepreneurs, expert sellers, and innovative thought leaders.

We recently raised $66 million USD in Series A from leading investors and serve over 200,000+ sellers to drive growth, maximize profitability and manage with intelligence to scale their businesses.

The Opportunity (Remote, Contract)

Your Impact 

  • Handling and assisting with Accounts Payable and Accounts Receivable.
  • Assist with month end and year end close.
  • Managing bank reconciliations and payment processor accounts.
  • Posting journal entries. 
  • Assist with any other tasks as discussed. 

Your Qualifications: 

  • 3+ years of accounting/bookkeeping experience.
  • Knowledge of QuickBooks online. 
  • Experience in accrual accounting, and entering payroll journal entries.
  • Netsuite knowledge preferred.
  • Advanced knowledge of excel.
  • Self-starter with strong interpersonal skills, and the ability to meet tight deadlines.

To Apply: 

  • Submit your resume.

results.title: UI Design Tutors and Mentors (f/m/d)
results.description:
We created CareerFoundry to help others build their careers while maintaining personal freedom and flexibility. Our 100% online, flexible, mentor/tutor driven courses are setting the standard for globally accessible technical education. Through our online programs, expert tutors and mentors bring students from complete beginners to junior UI designers in 6 months.

We are searching for experienced and passionate UI designers to join our pool of experts. Help define the next generation of design talent by educating and empowering students across the globe while working remotely and around your own schedule!

Your Mission:

Mentoring with CareerFoundry is more than teaching. It’s inspiring newcomers to the field to build, to problem solve, to think like a designer, and to increase their value as professionals.

**Based on your application and experience, we will make a decision on whether the Tutor or Mentor role is the perfect fit for you.

Mentor role:

Students need more than help and experience to master the necessary skills, they need inspiration and motivation to keep them focused along the way. You're their point of entry into a new industry, so they’ll want to hear about challenges you have overcome and what the role is really like on a day-to-day basis.

Tasks:

  • Reviewing your students’ work through the CareerFoundry platform on a regular basis with a view on how it would fit into an industry-ready portfolio.
  • Be available for 1-to-1 video calls to help prepare your students entry into their new industry.
  • Suggesting supplemental learning materials and personal insights in areas where students are struggling.
  • Teaming up with a tutor to answer more advanced queries or for a higher level of troubleshooting.
  • Responding to students within < 48 hours.

Tutor role:

Tutors give vital feedback on assignments through written reviews guided by our course curriculum and rubrics. When students are struggling with understanding a key area, tutors are there to support and encourage them, sharing resources and providing insights into the industry.

Tasks:

  • Regularly reviewing student exercises submitted through the CareerFoundry platform.
  • Submission reviews and checking for fundamental understanding of concepts.
  • Suggesting supplemental learning materials and personal insights in areas where students are struggling.
  • Working with a mentor who will advise the student specifically on career-related topics and support you as a tutor.
  • Responding to students within < 24 hours.

Requirements

To succeed, you must enjoy sharing your knowledge and be willing to work with students from beginner level onwards.

Mentor role:

  • Experience in the field as a Senior UI Designer, Creative Lead, Product Design Lead, Art Director, and a demonstrable track record showcasing your work for a variety of clients and companies.
  • A portfolio demonstrating your skill and examples of professional projects. Professional references may be required.
  • Previous experience in mentorship or tutoring is preferred. You must demonstrate an understanding of how to support beginners, have time and patience and a strong desire to guide people along their career path in this field.
  • Knowledge of the latest development tools and trends, a broad network of experts in the field and an in-depth understanding of industry practices.
  • Fluent in English.

Tutor role:

  • 2+ years experience in the field, working as a (Junior to Mid-Level) UI designer.
  • A great portfolio.
  • In depth knowledge of industry best practices.
  • A strong desire to help others.
  • Fluent in English.

Benefits

  • 100% Remote and flexible - work from anywhere with an internet connection, and around your schedule.
  • A freelance contract with a competitive rate.
  • Shape the industry by developing the next generation of designers.
  • Resume gold – mentoring experience is highly sought after by employers.

CareerFoundry is an equal opportunity employer. It is our commitment that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. We encourage in particular BiPoC, Migrants, people from under-represented communities, people who identify as queer, trans, and/ or intersex, people
with chronic illnesses, and people with disabilities to apply!


For inquiries please contact the team at talent.instructors@careerfoundry.com

We're looking forward to hearing from you!

results.title: Senior Game Developer
results.description:
Would you like to use your tech skills to make a real social impact in the healthcare sector? Then we have an awesome opportunity for you! We're looking for an ambitious and all round Senior Game Developer to take our existing VR Apps to the next level.

 

 

As a Senior Game Developer at SyncVR, you will be on a mission to bring our VR apps, that we build in Unity, to a consumer grade quality. You will be in Unity, code or your 3D design app of choice to build our apps, but also in contact with our customers and users to gather their wishes and requirements. You will work with a team of young and ambitious developers, and use your knowledge and skills to inspire them as well. Of course, you will be on a constant quest to push the limits of what we can do on our standalone VR devices.

 

 

 

What's in it for you?

You are entering a start-up. This means you get full freedom and responsibility by working on big impactful projects instead of tasks. You determine your own hours, where you work and how many holidays you need. Within a bootstrapped start-up there are no rockstar salaries, but we do share our company with key people in the company. For this role the salary is between €3.000-€5.000 and after one year you can become part of our stock-option program through which you can become a co-owner of SyncVR! The main reason why people join our team is that we all get up in the morning fueled by the idea that we make an impact on people's lives.

All salaries are transparent throughout the team: everyone knows what everyone earns, so that compensation is 100% fair and open.

Enough about us. Let’s talk about you!

  • You are a senior game developer with a track record that makes you proud;

  • You are eager to lead and inspire a team of young ambitious people;

  • You are an all-rounder, not only focused on writing code, but on building an entire app;

  • You are a Unity expert and like to try out new VR devices;

  • You are hyped about the potential of XR in the healthcare;

  • You live somewhere in the EU and have a working permit;

  • You choose this job with a specific reason, let us know why!

Checked at least 3 boxes and ready to rock & roll? Apply straight away via our career & culture page at syncvr.tech/careers

*Acquisition on the basis of this vacancy is not appreciated.

results.title: Senior Consultant
results.description:
Senior Consultant

Full-time, Part-time and Remote opportunities available

About Us

We're Nine Feet Tall … and growing!  We're a management consultancy that specialises in delivering complex change, combining the power of people and technology. Over the last sixteen years, we've delivered over £100m of value to our clients. We take the pain out of change and strive to help the transition to new ways of working.

Our Consultants come from all backgrounds but have one thing in common – we use our core values to guide our decision making - acting with integrity and doing the right thing, always striving for excellence and delivering with real passion.

If you're already in the world of consulting but it doesn't feel right, come and talk to us. Alternatively, if you're looking for more variety in your work and feel that consulting could be an option for you, we'd love to hear from you.

About You

Your career to date may have touched on all sorts of disciplines – Business Analysis, IT Project Management, PMO, Change Management - and you're looking for a role where you get the diversity of opportunity to continue with each element, or focus in on what you're really keen to specialise in.

You'll be ready to play a key role in the delivery of client engagements. You'll get to take the lead on specific deliverables and flex your project management know-how on critical workstreams.

But you'll also enjoy helping less experienced members of the team make the same journey you have.

The Role

The Senior Consultant role is one of the most diverse positions we have. You could be running workshops, delivering projects or helping to manage change - and you'll get experience of all kinds of different projects in a range of sectors. It's a role that can really fast-track your career.

We'll provide you with a focused learning and development programme to develop you into a successful consultant. It's not just about client delivery, it's about becoming a mentor to others and building the consultancy skill set to launch your career.

It's a position that will start to pull together all the key skills and attributes that you've gained so far, whilst also seeking out and developing the skills you probably haven't had the chance to fully engage with yet.

Why Apply?

We deliver all the capabilities of large consultancy with far less jargon and a lot more personality.

This is a great role to introduce yourself to Nine Feet Tall. How quickly you progress through our consultancy grades is up to you.

As an employer, we're proud to be truly flexible. We work hard to help our team find balance in their working and personal lives. That's why we're happy to consider applicants on either a full-time or flexible working (part-time 4 days per week or flexi-hours) basis. You'll be home-based in the first instance, with flexibility to come to our office in Bath 1 -2 times per month to training and for our regular Company Days that play a big role in our cohesive team culture.

We are growing our team across all roles so we'd love to hear from you and tell you more about what's on offer.

Remuneration

£35,000+ plus bonus and a competitive benefits package

Nine Feet Tall is an equal opportunities employer. We know that the principles of diversity, equality and inclusion are key to being a successful and dynamic business - with a team which is engaged and where everyone feels a sense of belonging and is happy to be themselves.

results.title: Senior Product Manager e-Invoicing B2B / B2G (f/m/d)
results.description:
Company Description

ecosio is a fast-growing, innovative service company and a leading provider of B2B integration, specialising in electronic data interchange (EDI), supplier relationship management (SRM) and e-invoicing. 

Our brand slogan is Connections That Work as we believe strong connections are central to successful business relationships - both external and internal. At ecosio, we hire individuals from all backgrounds and are committed to creating an inclusive work environment. We are technology lovers, set the highest standards for our solutions, and put innovative ideas first.



Job Description

You'll connect with the role if you enjoy...

  • taking ownership of our e-invoicing product and defining its roadmap, vision and strategy

  • researching and collecting requirements of international e-invoicing regulations and relaying these to our Legal team, Development team, Marketing team, Sales team and our Onboarding & Operations team

  • preparing research and written documentation for our Development team as well our Onboarding & Operations team

  • partnering with our Marketing team to design and launch campaigns designed to create a measurable pipeline with key enterprise buyers.

  • preparing pre-sales material to be used by the Sales and Marketing teams as well as joining customer calls

  • communicating strategy, tactics and progress to all stakeholders



Qualifications

To connect with ecosio it is important to have…

  • profound know-how of the e-invoicing domain and several years of  experience in that field in a similar position

  • a deep understanding of the technical foundations of e-invoicing (XML, JSON, RESTFUL Services, Peppol, Digital Signatures, etc.) as well as all involved technologies and ability to assess the complexity of API specifications, format specifications, archiving specifications, signature specifications etc.

  • the necessary  drive  to immerse into new requirements regarding e-invoicing regulations, sometimes even provided in different languages than English

  • strong communication skills and enjoying to liaise with other e-invoicing stakeholders internally and externally - e.g. as part of our membership with EESPA, VER, OpenPeppol, etc. and at various conferences, such as the Exchange Summit and EESPA Annual General Meeting

  • excellent organisation and prioritisation skills for collaborating with all stakeholders

  • the willingness to take initiative and make a difference by taking ownership of all tasks concerning ecosio.invoicing



Additional Information

By connecting with us you will experience...

  • flexible working hours, with the possibility to work 100% remotely
  • open corporate culture and flat hierarchies
  • employee events and happiness team for little smiles along the way
  • ongoing training and development 
  • passionate team that will win your heart

Sounds like a connection that works? Then apply now and we will get in touch soon!

results.title: UX Designer
results.description:
About Grio

Founded in 2008, Grio prides itself in being a premier full-service web and mobile software consulting agency based in San Francisco, CA. So, why join Grio? As a remote-work first company, Grio is committed to hiring teams with diverse backgrounds for the purpose of promoting creativity, and believes great ideas come from teams with various perspectives. This means you get to work with team members located across the globe – from Mexico City to New York and everything in between.

Our employees boast about the positive collaboration they experience with their teammates and the company’s commitment to work/life flexibility. This speaks volumes to Grio’s year over year growth , repeat clients, and even repeat employees! We take an empathic approach to ensure that we’re delivering the best possible products to our clients, and use that same lens to create a culture of engagement for our employees.

About the Role

Grio is looking for a fully remote, full-time, UX Designer to join our design team. In this role, you will have an exciting opportunity to work on interesting and complex problems across a variety of industries. This is what to expect during your first year with Grio as a UX Designer:

  • You will complete 3-4 UX projects for a variety of clients and industries including but not limited to Insurance, Architecture, Ecommerce, and Manufacturing.
  • You will learn how Grio project teams of designers, product and project managers, QA engineers, and software developers work together to deliver high quality products and solutions to clients.
  • You will build a relationship with the Grio design team through team meetings and project work. The design team is a close knit group of designers who encourage, support, and learn from each other.
  • You will meet Grio employees through project work, All Hands meetings, and other Grio sponsored virtual and in-person social activities.
  • You will maintain Grio’s high standards of communication with your ability to actively listen to clients to strengthen relationships and build trust.

Requirements

About You

You ideally have previous experience working with clients or in a design agency, can work independently and autonomously, pivot easily and run in a different direction when needed, and can receive constructive feedback without losing momentum. We are seeking someone who enjoys simplifying complex workflows, advocating for users, has problem-solving and active listening skills with the ability to ask critical questions of clients, and can communicate designs and their nuances to engineers and stakeholders. You should have strong experience working with a distributed workforce in a highly-collaborative environment. To be considered, please answer the screening questions and share your resume. A portfolio is optional to apply.

  • 4+ years of experience in a client-facing role, preferably in an agency setting, with proven success communicating design concepts, rationale, and technical terminology to clients
  • Extensive experience with the following:
    • Planning interviews and user testing, moderating feedback sessions, analysis, and applying the insights to UX deliverables
    • Creating UX deliverables such as site maps, user flows, and both low- and high- fidelity wireframes
    • Designing for web, responsive web, and native mobile platforms
    • Writing UX documentation that allows the development team to implement solutions successfully
    • Collaborating with cross-functional teams (fellow designers, product managers, developers) to create and deliver designs solutions that meet project requirements
  • Experience with Figma

Grio is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. You will not be discriminated against based on your age, race, gender, sexual orientation, sexual identity, religion, disability, veteran status, national origin, marital status or any other applicable characteristics protected by law.

If you love what you do and want to work hard to build innovative software then we encourage you to please apply!

Benefits

  • Enjoy the flexibility of working on different projects, technologies and industries for different clients.
  • 100% paid health and wellness benefits; 50% paid for spouses and dependents.
  • An educational allowance that coincides with the company’s life-long commitment to learning and development for all of its staff.
  • Compensation packages that let you share in the company’s long-term success.
  • A 5% 401(k) company match – that’s free money in your pocket!
  • Sick days & a generous vacation policy – the longer your tenure, the more vacay time you accrue.
